TEXT:
NB:   The murder # is nearly 5,000 since '93   (4,881) -- not 7,500.       We're
not very good at math!

                       Statementof the President on FBI Crime Statistics

        Crime rates continue to fall dramatically throughout the country, and it's no accident.
With community police at the center of our efforts, we have worked to give communities the
tools they need to rid their neighborhoods of gangs, guns and drugs. We have made real
progress: there are nearly 5,000 fewer murders in America today than in 1993.

        Now, we need to take juvenile crime head on. The spending bill I will sign next week
includes more than $100 million to hire scoresoflocal prosecutors, probation officers, and others
to crack down on gangs. Combined with new after school programs and a $195 million
anti-drug media campaign, we can begiri to pursue a strategy that works to keep all of our youth
on track.       .
